info.titleen: I was driving at about 40 miles per hour.
info.descko: 엄마의 생일선물을 고민하는 남자친구를 위해 여자친구가 제안한 방법은?
info.descen: How about baking a birthday cake for her?

sentense.en: 22You look so serious, Peter. What's up?
sentense.ko: 22피터 너무 심각하게 보여. 무슨 일이 있니?

sentense.en: I am thinking about what to buy for her.
How about a scarf?
I already gave her one last year.
sentense.ko: 그녀에게 작년에 이미 하나 사 줬어.

sentense.en: Then how about a bag?
My dad is probably going to give her a bag.
sentense.ko: 아버지가 아마 그녀에게 가방을 사 드릴꺼야.

sentense.en: I want to give my mom something special this year.
sentense.ko: 나는 금년에는 좀 특별한 것을 어머니에게 드리고 싶어.

sentense.en: How about baking a birthday cake for her?
I don't know how and I don't have enough time.
sentense.ko: 나는 어떻게 굽는줄도 모르고 시간도 충분치 않아.

sentense.en: I'll help you. Let's get started.
You are such a great friend.
Could you take off your shoes, sir?
We have to check them.
sentense.ko: 우리는 꼭 그것을 체크 해야 됩니다.

sentense.en: It's airport policy.
Sir, please step aside.
Do you have any metal in your pockets?
Did the book I ordered come in?
That's why I'm calling.
We've just received a message from the publishing company.
There will be a delay on your order.
I need it for a paper I'm writing.
sentense.ko: 지금 쓰고 있는 논문을 위해 필요합니다.

sentense.en: I'm afraid it will be another two weeks before it's available.
sentense.ko: 도착하기까지는 앞으로도 2주는 있어야 할 것으로 생각됩니다.

sentense.en: Two weeks? This is terrible.
What would you like us to do? Do you want us to cancel the order?
sentense.ko: 우리가 어떻게 하면 되겠습니까? 주문을 취소하길 원하세요?

sentense.en: I really want the book, so I'll wait for it.
sentense.ko: 난 그 책이 꼭 필요해요, 그러니까 기다릴게요.

sentense.en: I haven't seen you in months. What's new?
Are you still working at the bank?
I left the bank and moved to the country.
I have a small farm there.
You loved your job, didn't you?
sentense.ko: 너 은행일을 아주 좋아했잖아, 그렇지 않니?

sentense.en: I was getting tired of city life.
Also, I've always dreamed of writing.
sentense.ko: 또한, 난 언제나 글을 쓰는 꿈이있었지.

sentense.en: So, I've been working on a book of poetry.
Poetry? That's great! How's it coming?
She stood me up.
How did it go?
The service here is terrible!
That movie really sucked.
Let’s all chip in and buy him a nice present.
sentense.ko: 우리 돈을 모아서 그 사람한테 좋은 선물 사주자.

sentense.en: I don’t hold a grudge.
Get over it!
It’s time for you to move on.
You really hurt my feelings.
I’ll never forget what you said.
sentense.ko: 나한테 한 말을 절대 잊지 않을 거예요

sentense.en: We just missed it.
Don’t keep me waiting.
What do you usually do in your free time?
I didn’t have the heart to tell him.
How did he take the news?
He didn’t bat an eye.
It’s your fault.
I’m all ears!
Don’t interrupt!
The thing is, we won’t be finished before Friday.
sentense.ko: 사실은 우리가 금요일 전에 끝이 안 날 것 같아요.

sentense.en: Thanks for your understanding.
She’s very high maintenance.
Stay focused!
I’ve been trying to stay out of trouble.
Stay out of my business.
Do you mind if I use this?
No wonder you speak English so well.
I’ve got a lot on my mind right now.
I’ve got a lot on my plate.
That’s what I hate about working here.
sentense.ko: 여기서 일하는 게 싫은 이유가 바로 그거예요!

sentense.en: Don’t talk about me behind my back!
sentense.ko: 나 없을 때 내 이야기 하지 말아요!

sentense.en: Don’t spread rumors!

I think we got off on the wrong foot.

sentense.en: We really hit it off.

You never get a second chance to make a first impression.

sentense.en: I’m looking forward to it.
Don’t blame me!
It’s your responsibility.
What’s your take on it?

sentense.en: We could have dinner at 6, and then go to a movie.
sentense.ko: 우리는 6시에 저녁 식사를 하고 그런 다음 영화를 보러 갈 수 있어.

sentense.ko: 우리 엄마는 오늘 오후에 쿠키를 구울 거야.

sentense.en: That sounds fantastic!
Are you going to the grocery store today?
I’m sorry, could you please talk slower?
What do you do, Tom?
I work at the university as a financial specialist.
sentense.ko: 저는 재정 전문가로 대학에서 일하고 있어요.

sentense.en: So Tom, what do you like to do in your free time?
sentense.ko: 톰, 시간 있을 때에 뭘 하는 걸 좋아하세요?

sentense.en: I love to read and to garden.
sentense.ko: 저는 책을 읽고 정원을 가꾸는 것을 좋아해요.

sentense.en: I picked two buckets of tomatoes last week!
sentense.ko: 저는 지난 달에 토마토를 두 통이나 땄어요!

sentense.en: It would be great to meet up again sometime.

sentense.ko: 그래, 샘이 오늘 밤 8시에 오는 거 맞지?

sentense.en: Actually, I thought he wasn’t working at all this week.
sentense.ko: 사실, 나는  그가 이번 주에 일을 안 한다고 생각했는데.

sentense.en: I’ll have to look at the schedule again.
Did you finish the reports?

sentense.ko: 사실, 저는 좀 늦어지고 있어요. 그렇지만 정오 무렵엔 끝날 거예요!

sentense.en: He always talks back to me, that's why I don't like him.
sentense.ko: 그는 항상 나에게 말대꾸를 해요, 그것 때문에 그가 싫어요.

sentense.en: I don't have any excuses for my behavior.
sentense.ko: 나의 행동에 대해 드릴 말씀이 없습니다.

sentense.en: I apologize for it.
I owe you an apology.

Don’t interfere in what doesn’t concern you.

sentense.en: I need a new car.
I hope it snows.

I hope you can make it.

sentense.en: I hope my plane leaves on time.
sentense.ko: 내가 탈 비행기가 제시간에 출발 했으면 좋겠다.

sentense.en: Can I help you?

sentense.en: I want a position with more responsibility.

Feel free to ask me if you have any questions.
Feel free to tell us if you want anything.
